page.title: 06FARMING: QUINTON
page.content: The number of separate farms is now significantly reduced in the area. Many of the{tenancies}have been absorbed into larger-scale operations. Magdalen College, Oxford continues to be a major local{landowner. There is one mainly dairy farm, one wholly sheep farm and two wholly arable farms. The remainder are combinations of beef, sheep and arable farms. Increased{mechanisation}has reduced the numbers of workers on the land to a handful, who tend to work co'operatively when the need arises. Farm{produce}includes barley,wheat, oats, oilseed rape, and potatoes. Much farm machinery is sold,repaired and serviced in the village garage. Stock and produce is sold in Stratford or Banbury market. There is some market gardening in the area.{
